messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Traditions
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hey, do you know Terry Stafford or Pat Lucey?  I know Terry is a DRE near Vancouver, and I m not sure what Pat is near Ottawa, but something like that. Tia
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>Each Christmas, we each make each family member a made-present. It's become a
>tradition for Beth to make Julian a nightshirt. (She asked him the other day
>if, at twelve, he'd prefer something different. He gave her a HORRIFIED
>look!) We open these gifts on Christmas eve, while eating cookies and
>drinking cocoa, after coming back from the Christmas eve service at church.
>(I work for a Unitarian Universalist church as Director of Religious
>Education, so I'm usually involved in the service itself.)

Hey, do you know Terry Stafford or Pat Lucey? I know Terry is a DRE near
Vancouver, and I'm not sure what Pat is near Ottawa, but something like that.
Tia

Tia Leschke leschke@...
On Vancouver Island
********************************************************************************************
It is the answers which separate us, the questions which unite us. - Janice
Levy

messages.subject: Traditions
messages.msgSnippet: I would love to hear about people s traditions as we approach holidays.  Here is my favorite of ours: Each Christmas, we each make each family member a
messages.messageBody:
I would love to hear about people's traditions as we approach holidays. Here
is my favorite of ours:

Each Christmas, we each make each family member a made-present. It's become a
tradition for Beth to make Julian a nightshirt. (She asked him the other day
if, at twelve, he'd prefer something different. He gave her a HORRIFIED
look!) We open these gifts on Christmas eve, while eating cookies and
drinking cocoa, after coming back from the Christmas eve service at church.
(I work for a Unitarian Universalist church as Director of Religious
Education, so I'm usually involved in the service itself.)

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
